title: Make pkg/k8s tests deterministic and remove prod test helpers
description:
Background:
- pkg/k8s/client_test.go currently depends on host ~/.kube/config / in-cluster state, which can make tests pass/fail depending on the developer machine.
- pkg/k8s has unexported *test-only* helpers (e.g. newClientFromInterface*) living in non-_test.go files, which ships dead code in production builds.

Acceptance criteria:
- Make TestBuildConfig deterministic by controlling HOME/KUBECONFIG and using a temp HOME without ~/.kube/config.
- Move newClientFromInterface/newClientFromClientset/newClientFromInterfaceWithConfig into a shared *_test.go helper (or internal testutil) so production build has no test scaffolding.
- Ensure go test ./... passes reliably on a machine that DOES have ~/.kube/config.

title: Harden retry logic (errors.As, narrower retry set, testable backoff)
description:
Background:
- pkg/k8s/retry.go treats any non-*errors.StatusError as retryable, which can retry programmer/validation errors and hide real failures.
- Type assertions should use errors.As because k8s errors are often wrapped.
- Backoff uses time.After directly, making timing tests flaky and behavior hard to test deterministically.

Acceptance criteria:
- Use errors.Is / errors.As for context cancellation + StatusError detection.
- Retry only well-defined transient classes (timeouts, temporary net errors, 5xx, 429/408); do not blindly retry all generic errors.
- Replace ParseRetryAfterHeader RFC1123-only parsing with http.ParseTime.
- Make backoff/sleep injectable so tests can validate retry schedule without wall-clock timing.
- Keep public API stable (WithRetry / RetryConfig).

title: Revisit global Kubernetes client singleton and package-level wrappers
description:
Background:
- pkg/k8s/GetClient caches a global singleton; the first caller's ClientConfig wins, later callers with different kubeconfig/context are ignored.
- The package-level wrappers (k8s.CordonNode, k8s.ListPodsOnNode, etc.) implicitly depend on that singleton, making tests and multi-cluster usage harder.

Acceptance criteria:
- Decide on a single pattern: (A) pass *Client explicitly everywhere, or (B) keyed cache by ClientConfig (and document behavior), or (C) keep singleton but remove cfg from GetClient to avoid false expectations.
- Add tests covering the chosen behavior (especially config mismatch).
- Ensure ExecInPod errors cleanly when c.config is nil (instead of panicking) to make partial clients safe in tests.
